frameDefinitions: The answer to a Question is under discussion in a Group, which still  has a difference of opinion among its members.

An Initial_element is converted into a Final_element via a process of decay, fusion, or fission which changes the number or type of hadrons (protons or neutrons) in the nucleus of the atoms that make up the Element.
A Whole breaks apart into Pieces, resulting in the loss of the Whole (and in most cases, no piece that has a separate function).
An Agent has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an Opportunity, a situation not completely under the Agent's control and usually of a limited duration.
This frame concerns transparent nouns that denote Instances of Types of entities or events.
There exist a number of different possible Situations that may happen in the future.
frameExamples: Firstly, it is quite clear the <t>issue</t> in this context was not so much apostasy as much as it was treason.
5.5 percent of nucleii <t>decay</t> from tritium to He3 in a year .
The plane violently <t>broke apart</t> in mid-air.
It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> absence of the clergyman to have a dance . DNI

The survey confirmed that management interference in team operations had increased , and <t><fex name='Instance'>instances</fex></t> of management decisions being taken without team consultation had also increased .
You have but two <t><fex name='Situation'>choices</fex></t> for your daughter .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Question</fen> is an open proposition the answer to which is under dispute.
The time interval during which the <fen>Question</fen> exists as a problem for the <fen>Group</fen>.
A substance definable in terms of the kind(s) of atoms that make it up.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that results from the process.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that begins the process.
The time at which the <fen>Element</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location where the nuclear process occurs.
The <fen>Whole</fen> goes into <fen>Pieces</fen> which were not (necessarily) definable subparts prior to breaking.
The <fen>Pieces</fen> result from the breaking apart of the <fen>Whole</fen>.
The time at which the breaking apart takes place.w
The location at which the breaking apart takes place.
The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target.
The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.
A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.
A thing or episode of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of thing or event of which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
Something that may happen in the future, or at least whose factual status is unresolved. This is often tagged in a second role layer and generally contains the target.

An individual involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.

'<fex name='Agent'>You</fex> have a <t>choice</t>.'
An entity intimately involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The issue is <fex>who will have control of Iraq's rich oil resources</fex>.

The issue <fex>at the time</fex> was whether or not to relocate the Rennes-based part of
the team to California.
I collected two <t>specimens</t> <fex>of this rare species</fex>.
You have one choice to make <fex>for him</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The American Graduate School of International Management
The American Family: Discovering the Values that Make Us Strong
